texts.definition: Penalties shared between some or all players for a failure to meet a requirement in a game.
markups: <style="Definition">Penalties shared between some or all players for a failure to meet a requirement in a game.</style>

Games where players, willingly or by force, strive towards achieving common goals usually have <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> for failing those goals - in some cases the only common goal can be to avoid the <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style>. These penalties may be the loss of common resources or the division of penalties between individual players but the penalties are treated as one penalty for failing one action or goal.

Losing matches in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Counter-Strike%20series">Counter-Strike</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ice%20Hockey">Ice Hockey</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/League%20of%20Legends">League of Legends</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Soccer">Soccer</link></style> are all examples of <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style>. In cooperative games such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dead%20of%20Winter">Dead of Winter</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Lord%20of%20the%20Rings">Lord of the Rings</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pandemic">Pandemic</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Space%20Alert">Space Alert</link></style> the players can all lose if things go too bad, but also smaller setbacks can affect all players equally in some of the games.

Game masters in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Roleplaying%20Games">Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warhammer%20Fantasy%20Roleplay">Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay</link></style> can apply penalties to all party if they fail with quests they have been given.

<style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> can be used for several purposes. One is to give players the <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> of avoiding them and another is to attach them to already existing <style="Link"><link="mutual-goals">Mutual Goals</link></style> to make them more important. If <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> can be the result of failing <style="Link"><link="collaborative-actions">Collaborative Actions</link></style>, the combination makes players have <style="Link"><link="committed-goals">Committed Goals</link></style>. They are one essential part of creating <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> (the other being <style="Link"><link="shared-rewards">Shared Rewards</link></style>). They can also be used to strengthen the ties of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Alliances">Alliances</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="factions">Factions</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Social%20Organizations">Social Organizations</link></style> as well as being the basis for many types of <style="Link"><link="social-dilemmas">Social Dilemmas</link></style>. Sometimes <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> are simply the effect of <style="Link"><link="tied-results">Tied Results</link></style> (which can be avoid through using <style="Link"><link="tiebreakers">Tiebreakers</link></style>). <style="Link"><link="team-elimination">Team Elimination</link></style> is a self-explaining example of a <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> can be modified in a couple of different ways. First of all, the <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> may be applied to <style="Link"><link="shared-resources">Shared Resources</link></style>. Second

it might be possible <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Negotiation">Negotiation</link></style> if and when the <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> should be taken, and this can be taken even further be having <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Player-Decided%20Distributions">Player-Decided Distributions</link></style> of the <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style>.

<style="Link"><link="altruistic-actions">Altruistic Actions</link></style> may make <style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> impossible if they allow players to take a <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalty</link></style> so nobody else has to.

<style="CurrentLink">Shared Penalties</style> are obviously a form of <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style>. Experiencing them together with other can give these people the sense of <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style>. Handling how to manage or distribute them, or when they may be acceptable to take, may define a <style="Link"><link="social-roles">Social Role</link></style>.

They are obviously not <style="Link"><link="individual-penalties">Individual Penalties</link></style> but being the target of them may work against players feeling an <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style> since they may not be the reasons why they got penalized.
